intro: Sida crispa, commonly known as the hairy sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. Its small, pale yellow flowers are typically clustered in inflorescences. Sida crispa is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in coastal areas.
